main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified aerial phenomena at Camp Hood, Texas in June 1949, including brilliant lights, unusual aerial objects, and emergency aircraft landings.
interesting points: One observation described an object with a 1000-yard tail, moving at a speed of over 2000 mph, and emitting bright colors.
The sightings involved military officers, and one observer was noted as a superior observer due to their intelligence and character.
Observers reported seeing unusual aerial objects disintegrating into smaller objects and disappearing rapidly.
A civilian aircraft made an emergency landing, causing damage to the area, with no evidence of cameras or explosives found during the investigation.
An Army officer with expertise in photography and paleontology was among the observers, and several witnesses were considered excellent observers by the interrogator.
witnesses: US Army officers, artillery personnel, civilian pilot
